text: Job Bulters (born 22 March 1986 in Haarlem)) is a Dutch retired professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper. ==Club career== He made his breakthrough for AZ's first squad in 2006, when AZ's first and second keeper, Joey Didulica and Khalid Sinouh, were injured. After some luckless games, AZ brought Ronald Waterreus to the club as a replacement. Bulters contract was not extended at the end of the season. Therefore, he continued his career at Stormvogels Telstar, making his debut on 11 April 2008,Debuut Job Bulters bij SV Telstar - NH Nieuws and the next season he became second keeper with MVV Maastricht.'Boffin krijgt bij MVV Bulters als concurrent' - Voetbal International On August 19, 2012 he signed a one-year deal with Helmond Sport. He moved abroad to play for Belgian side Turnhout, only to return to Holland a year later to join amateurs EHC. He announced his retirement a year later.Doelman Job Bulters hangt (waarschijnlijk) de schoenen aan de wilgen - EHC ==International career== In 2005, he was part of the Dutch squad at the FIFA World Youth Championship.Netherlands Roster - FIFA ==References== ==External links== *VI Profile - Job Bulters *Dutch Wikipedia Category:1986 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Haarlem Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Dutch footballers Category:Netherlands under-21 international footballers Category:Netherlands youth international footballers Category:AZ Alkmaar players Category:SC Telstar players Category:MVV Maastricht players Category:Helmond Sport players Category:KFC Turnhout players Category:Eredivisie players Category:Eerste Divisie players Category:Dutch expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Belgium Category:Dutch expatriate sportspeople in Belgium Category:EHC Hoensbroek players
title: Job Bulters
